item.title: Report X-2024100219
item.description:
Report X-2024100219

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER AT DOOR 56 IN THE UNLOAD USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR AT DOOR 56, THE PACKAGE WAS UPRIGHT NO CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED THERE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE UNLOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED THE PACKAGE UP, THERE WERE 4-1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ZEP CONCENTRATED CALCIUM, LIME RUST STAIN REMOVER, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP , RESPONDER PROCESED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024100194
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: SYLMAR

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN A PACKAGE CAR. UPON ARRIVAL NOTICED A CLASS 8 DIAMOND LABEL, FOLLOWING THE DECCISSION TREE, RESPONDER WAS LED TO CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. CLEANED UP SPILL AND BROUGHT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024100048
item.description:
Report E-2024100048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3214 was shipped with a faulty cap and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove all residual product from the impacted surfaces. The impacted wood, spent absorbent pads, spent granular absorbents, and all UN3214 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum

item.title: Report I-2024090068
item.description:
Report I-2024090068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SINGAPORE AIRLINES LIMITED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Agent, Andre Senior, was locating the shipment into the third level of the warehouse racks. When one box fell from the skid while being positioned into racks. Once box fell then it started emanating smoke as it was being burnt. Our Warehouse Manager, Julio Galvez actioned upon seeing this situation happening and box was segregated by our warehouse supervisor, Miguel Lopez, and taken outside of the warehouse for any other reaction from the DG.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIS REPORT DOES NOT INVOLVE A SPILL, GOODS MISSING. UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD TORN OPEN WITH TWO BOTTLES MISSING. NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS ASIDE FROM 'LTD QTY' WRITTEN OUT ON LABEL. PACKAGE SDS INDICATES THAT GOODS ARE REGULATED. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024091732
item.description:
Report X-2024091732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the OAKH location a shipment was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a single can of spray paint UN1950. There was no DG marking on the package or paperwork needed for movement. The can of spray paint released all of it's contents inside of the envelope. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location for the FAA.
